YOU HAVE GOT A READ ONLY FILE IN /usr/share/eclipse AND AS SUCH IT CAN'T CREATE A CONFIGURATION FILE. YOU NEED TO RUN IT WITH THE -configuration ARGUMENT AND SPECIFY A DIRECTORY WHERE YOU DO HAVE WRITE ACCESS E.G. ~/eclipse/configuration SO THAT IT CAN WRITE THINGS THERE.

Root exception:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Cannot create configuration in
file:/usr/share/eclipse/configuration/

YOU ALSO NEED TO GET SOMEONE TO FIX YOUR KEYBOARD SINCE THE SHIFT KEY IS STUCK, THOUGH YOU MIGHT ALSO HAVE THE CAPS LOCK STUCK ON.

I suggest this bug is closed WORKSFORME.

As Alex mentions, these errors commonly occur when the user doesn't have read/write access to the configuration location.

Closing as WORKSFORME.

Please re-open if the problem persists and you are able to provide us more information.
